findings.title: Inconsistency Between Document and Implementation
findings.description: There are a few misleading comments embedded among lines of solidity code, which bring unnecessary hurdles to understand and/or maintain the software.

findings.title: Suggested Reentrancy Prevention in TokenVesting And InsuranceFund
findings.description: The adherence of `checks-effects-interactions` principle is violated, which can lead to re-entrancy attacks. This vulnerability exists in multiple functions across different contracts.

findings.title: Improved Handling of Corner Cases in Proposal Submission
findings.description: The governance subsystem requires the proposer to obtain a sufficient number of votes, including from the proposer herself and other voters. The threshold is specified by `proposalThreshold`. In `dTrade`, this number will be initialized through the customized `initialize()` routine, which ensures the threshold falls between `[MIN_PROPOSAL_THRESHOLD, MAX_PROPOSAL_THRESHOLD]`.

findings.title: Full Charge of Proposal Execution Cost From Accompanying msg.value
findings.description: In the execute function of Governance contract, the transaction sender is responsible for supplying required amount of native tokens as each inherent action in the proposal may require accompanying certain native tokens.
